string.name: guide_abbreviated_input_body_row1
string.value: Type faster by entering only the first letters of each syllable. For example, typing “nh” gives you “你好”.

string.name: guide_abbreviated_input_body_row2
string.value: Combine abbreviated and full input for even more flexibility. For example, “nhou” or “neih” also produces “你好”.

string.name: guide_pinyin_reverse_lookup_body
string.value: Start with “r”, then enter Pinyin code. For example, “rlin” → “林”.

string.name: guide_cangjie_reverse_lookup_heading
string.value: Lookup Jyutping with Cangjie or Quick(Sucheng)

string.name: guide_cangjie_reverse_lookup_body_row1
string.value: Start with “v”, then enter Cangjie or Quick code. For example, “vdd” → “林”.

string.name: guide_stroke_reverse_lookup_body
string.value: Start with “x”, then enter Stroke code. For example, “xwsad” → “木”.

string.name: guide_stroke_reverse_lookup_examples
string.value:
w = 橫(waang), Horizontal
s = 豎(syu), Vertical
a = 撇, Left-falling
d = 點(dim), Right-falling
z = 折(zit), Turning

string.name: guide_structure_reverse_lookup_body
string.value: Start with “q”, then enter two components’ Jyutping. For example, “qmukmuk” → “林”.

string.name: guide_tones_input_body
string.value:
v = 1, High Level (陰平)
x = 2, Medium Rising (陰上)
q = 3, Medium Level (陰去)
vv = 4, Low Falling (陽平)
xx = 5, Low Rising (陽上)
qq = 6, Low Level (陽去)

string.name: guide_tones_input_examples
string.value: Examples: sinq = sin3(線), sinqq = sin6(羨)
